newsitem.title: POLAND: Polish c.bank to raise rates on Friday - paper.
newsitem.headline: Polish c.bank to raise rates on Friday - paper.

text.p: The National Bank of Poland (NBP) will raise its nominal rates on Friday, the Gazeta Wyborcza daily said, quoting unofficial sources on Thursday.

On Wednesday, NBP president Hanna Gronkiewicz-Waltz told the Dziennik Prawa i Gospodarki daily the bank would raise rates within the next few weeks to offset additional government borrowing from the bank for flood relief.
The central bank's press office had no comment on the Gazeta Wyborcza report. The NBP's discount and lombard rates, now at 22 and 25 percent, respectively have not been changed for more than a year.
